alert.note: Alert for Caswell (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 1:44PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Caswell County through 215 PM EDT... At 144 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Leasburg, or 7 miles east of Yanceyville, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Blanch... Leasburg... Hamer... Semora... Topnot... Hightowers... and Hyco Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
